channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: GT Capital donates vaccines to Makati
item.description: GT Capital Holdings Inc., in partnership with Metrobank Foundation Inc., donated 3,000 doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine to the city government of Makati last Sept. 30.

item.title: Human rights an election issue – CHR exec
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: With major social issues affecting the most basic rights of individuals, Filipino voters must support candidates with a clear human rights agenda in the upcoming elections, an official of the Commission on Human Rights said.

item.title: Thousands of politicians defecting to Isko’s party
item.author: Ghio Ong
item.description: Thousands of politicians have crossed over to Aksyon Demokratiko, which is now led by presidential aspirant and Manila Mayor Isko Moreno, a party official said last Friday.

item.title: Ping pushes emergency employment, food terminals
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: To address the problem of joblessness amid the COVID-19 pandemic, the government should prioritize setting up an emergency employment program and food terminals in each region, Sen. Panfilo Lacson said.

item.title: Perks for HCWs, income for affected workers sought
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Employers and labor groups are urging the government to immediately implement measures which include providing benefits to health care workers, income for employees who need to be quarantined and assistance for those affected by lockdowns, as well as to certify the Bayanihan 3 bill as urgent to support recovery from the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Jawo stamps mark PHLPost 75th anniversary
item.author: Robertzon Ramirez
item.description: The Philippine Postal Corporation unveiled yesterday stamps featuring basketball “living legend,” former senator Robert Jaworski, as part of activities lined up for the 75th anniversary of the country’s first stamp bearing the inauguration of the Philippine Republic released in 1946.

item.title: Initial Pharmally probe report set for release
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: The Senate Blue Ribbon committee will release this week the initial result of its investigation into the questionable multibillion-peso deal between Pharmally Pharmaceutical Corp. and the Procurement Service of the Department of Budget Management.

item.title: Philippines to heed WHO advice on 3rd dose
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Philippines will adhere to the recommendation of the World Health Organization to give a third dose of the COVID-19 vaccine to immunocompromised individuals and senior citizens, the Department of Health said.

item.title: Duterte vows return to glory for Marawi
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte yesterday assured the people of Marawi that the rehabilitation of the conflict-torn city would be fast-tracked and that the government remains committed to safeguarding the Philippines against terrorism.

item.title: 1,151 minors vaccinated on first day of pilot run
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: A total of 1,151 adolescents were inoculated against COVID-19 last Friday, prompting authorities to declare the first day of the pilot run of the government’s pediatric vaccination program a “success.”
